bibl.title: Charles W. Nordstrom v. William H. Moyer
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.ab: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHER DIVISION.

IN THE MATTER OF THE PETITION OF CHARLES W. NORDSTROM,
-vs-
WILLIAM H. MOYER, Sheriff King County, Washington.
div1.p: Comes now the petitioner and addressing himself to the Court, by his counsel and friend, James Hamiltom Lewis, and moves the Court for permission and order to amend the petition for relief herein, so that the same may conform to the opinion of the Supreme Court of the United States in the case as suggested and reported in the matter of Creamer, the said Creamer cause being the same as that of the petitioner, and being the test cause upon which the cause of petitioner was disposed.

Also petitioner moves the Court to permit the amendment further of the substitution of the name of A. T. Vandevanter as sheriff, in the place and stead of William H. Moyer. The said Vandevanter having succeeded the said Moyer as sheriff and to the custody of this petitioner,
WHEREFORE, Petitioner further prays for the relief as prayed for on his original petition.
In the Circuit Court OF THE UNITED STATES District of Washington, Northern Division
In the Matter of the Petition of Charles W. Nordstrom
div1.ab: Wm H. Moyer, as Sheriff of King County, Washington

Filed this 20th day of May 1899
A Reeves Ayres Clerk.
By A. N. Moore Deputy.

JAS. HAMILTON LEWIS,
Attorney for Petitioner

Offices-FIFTH FLOOR, PIONEER BLOCK
Corner First Ace. and James St. SEATTLE WASH.
The Review Printing Co., 117-121 Columbia St.
div1.p: Received copy of the within and service of same admitted this day of 189
